availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Versailles, Kentucky, native. Son of William Barr and Ann Watson Barr. Married to Susan Rogers Barr in November 1859. Father of John W. Barr, Jr., Anna W. Barr, and Caroline H. Barr. Graduated from the law school of Transylvania University in 1847. Practiced law in Versailles, Kentucky, until 1854. Practiced law alone and in partnership with Joseph B. Kinkead and John Kemp Goodloe. Attorney in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 6, p. 353.
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 159-60.
Biographical Cyclopedia of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Embracing Biographies of Many of the Prominent Men of the State (Chicago: John M. Gresham Company, 1896), 37-38.
“Death of Judge Barr,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), January 1, 1808, p. 4.
